description: International Classification of Diseases, 10th Revision, Clinical Modification - Respiratory and Related Codes

entries.title: R91.1 - Solitary Pulmonary Nodule
entries.content: Solitary pulmonary nodule (SPN). A single, well-defined round or oval lesion in the lung parenchyma, typically less than 3 cm in diameter, surrounded by normal lung tissue. May be incidentally detected on chest imaging. Requires characterization and follow-up based on size, morphology, and patient risk factors.

metadata.chapter: R - Symptoms, signs and abnormal clinical and laboratory findings

entries.title: R91.8 - Other Nonspecific Abnormal Findings of Lung Field
entries.content: Other nonspecific abnormal findings of lung field. Includes multiple pulmonary nodules, diffuse lung abnormalities, or other non-specific pulmonary findings that do not fit specific diagnostic categories. May require additional workup or correlation.

metadata.chapter: R - Symptoms, signs and abnormal clinical and laboratory findings

entries.title: C34.10 - Malignant Neoplasm of Upper Lobe, Unspecified Bronchus or Lung
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm (primary lung cancer) of the upper lobe, bronchus or lung, side unspecified. Upper lobe is the most common location for primary lung cancer. Includes adenocarcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, and other primary lung malignancies in this location.

metadata.chapter: C - Neoplasms

entries.title: C34.11 - Malignant Neoplasm of Upper Lobe, Right Bronchus or Lung
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of the right upper lobe bronchus or lung. Primary lung cancer in the right upper lobe, the most common site for lung malignancy. Right lung has three lobes (upper, middle, lower).

metadata.chapter: C - Neoplasms

entries.title: C34.12 - Malignant Neoplasm of Upper Lobe, Left Bronchus or Lung
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of the left upper lobe bronchus or lung. Primary lung cancer in the left upper lobe. Left lung has two lobes (upper and lower), with lingula being part of the upper lobe.

metadata.chapter: C - Neoplasms

entries.title: C34.2 - Malignant Neoplasm of Middle Lobe, Bronchus or Lung
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of the middle lobe bronchus or lung. Primary lung cancer in the right middle lobe. Note: Only the right lung has a middle lobe; the left lung has no middle lobe equivalent.

metadata.chapter: C - Neoplasms

entries.title: C34.30 - Malignant Neoplasm of Lower Lobe, Unspecified Bronchus or Lung
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of the lower lobe, bronchus or lung, side unspecified. Primary lung cancer in the lower lobe. Both right and left lungs have lower lobes.

metadata.chapter: C - Neoplasms

entries.title: C34.31 - Malignant Neoplasm of Lower Lobe, Right Bronchus or Lung
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of the right lower lobe bronchus or lung. Primary lung cancer in the right lower lobe.

metadata.chapter: C - Neoplasms

entries.title: C34.32 - Malignant Neoplasm of Lower Lobe, Left Bronchus or Lung
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of the left lower lobe bronchus or lung. Primary lung cancer in the left lower lobe.

metadata.chapter: C - Neoplasms

entries.title: C34.80 - Malignant Neoplasm of Overlapping Sites of Bronchus and Lung
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of overlapping sites of bronchus and lung. Use when tumor involves multiple lobes or when the origin cannot be assigned to a single lobe.

metadata.chapter: C - Neoplasms
metadata.usage: Multiple lobes involved or indeterminate origin

entries.title: C34.90 - Malignant Neoplasm of Unspecified Part of Bronchus or Lung
entries.content: Malignant neoplasm of unspecified part of bronchus or lung. Primary lung cancer, location not specified. Use when documentation does not specify the anatomic lobe or when tumor location is unknown.

metadata.chapter: C - Neoplasms

entries.title: C78.00 - Secondary Malignant Neoplasm of Lung, Unspecified
entries.content: Secondary malignant neoplasm of unspecified lung. Metastatic cancer to the lung from a primary site elsewhere. Lung is a common site for metastatic disease from breast, colon, kidney, and other primary cancers.

metadata.chapter: C - Neoplasms
metadata.note: Use for metastatic disease to lung, not primary lung cancer

entries.title: C78.01 - Secondary Malignant Neoplasm of Right Lung
entries.content: Secondary malignant neoplasm of right lung. Metastatic cancer to the right lung from primary malignancy elsewhere.

metadata.chapter: C - Neoplasms

entries.title: C78.02 - Secondary Malignant Neoplasm of Left Lung
entries.content: Secondary malignant neoplasm of left lung. Metastatic cancer to the left lung from primary malignancy elsewhere.

metadata.chapter: C - Neoplasms

entries.title: D14.30 - Benign Neoplasm of Unspecified Bronchus and Lung
entries.content: Benign neoplasm of unspecified bronchus and lung. Includes hamartoma (most common benign lung tumor), lipoma, fibroma, and other benign tumors of the lung.

metadata.chapter: D - Neoplasms

entries.title: D38.1 - Neoplasm of Uncertain Behavior of Trachea, Bronchus and Lung
entries.content: Neoplasm of uncertain behavior of trachea, bronchus and lung. Use when the behavior (benign vs malignant) of a pulmonary neoplasm cannot be determined. May require tissue diagnosis for definitive classification.

metadata.chapter: D - Neoplasms

entries.title: J84.10 - Pulmonary Fibrosis, Unspecified
entries.content: Pulmonary fibrosis, unspecified. Chronic progressive scarring of the lung parenchyma. May be idiopathic (IPF) or secondary to known causes. CT findings include reticular opacities, honeycombing, and traction bronchiectasis.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J84.112 - Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis
entries.content: Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). Chronic, progressive fibrosing interstitial pneumonia of unknown cause, primarily occurring in older adults. CT shows usual interstitial pneumonia (UIP) pattern with basal and peripheral predominance.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J84.89 - Other Specified Interstitial Pulmonary Diseases
entries.content: Other specified interstitial pulmonary diseases. Includes organizing pneumonia, lymphoid interstitial pneumonia, and other named interstitial lung diseases not classified elsewhere.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J84.9 - Interstitial Pulmonary Disease, Unspecified
entries.content: Interstitial pulmonary disease, unspecified. Use when interstitial lung disease is present but specific type is not documented or cannot be determined.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J43.9 - Emphysema, Unspecified
entries.content: Emphysema, unspecified. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease characterized by destruction of alveolar walls leading to airspace enlargement. CT shows areas of decreased attenuation without visible walls (low attenuation areas).

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J43.0 - Unilateral Pulmonary Emphysema
entries.content: Unilateral pulmonary emphysema (MacLeod syndrome, Swyer-James syndrome). Acquired hyperlucent lung, typically unilateral, often following childhood respiratory infection. CT shows unilateral air trapping and decreased vascularity.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J43.1 - Panlobular Emphysema
entries.content: Panlobular emphysema (panacinar emphysema). Uniform destruction of the entire acinus, typically associated with alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency. Often has lower lobe predominance.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J43.2 - Centrilobular Emphysema
entries.content: Centrilobular emphysema (centriacinar emphysema). Destruction centered on the respiratory bronchiole in the center of the secondary lobule. Most common form, typically smoking-related with upper lobe predominance.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J18.9 - Pneumonia, Unspecified Organism
entries.content: Pneumonia, unspecified organism. Acute infection of the lung parenchyma when the causative organism is not identified. CT may show consolidation, ground-glass opacity, or tree-in-bud nodularity.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J18.1 - Lobar Pneumonia, Unspecified Organism
entries.content: Lobar pneumonia, unspecified organism. Pneumonia affecting an entire lobe of the lung. Classic pattern with dense consolidation confined to a single lobe with air bronchograms.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J90 - Pleural Effusion, Not Elsewhere Classified
entries.content: Pleural effusion, not elsewhere classified. Abnormal accumulation of fluid in the pleural space. May be transudative or exudative. CT shows dependent fluid density in the pleural space.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J91.0 - Malignant Pleural Effusion
entries.content: Malignant pleural effusion. Pleural effusion due to malignancy, either primary pleural malignancy or metastatic disease. May be associated with pleural nodularity or thickening on CT.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J93.0 - Spontaneous Tension Pneumothorax
entries.content: Spontaneous tension pneumothorax. Life-threatening condition with progressive air accumulation in pleural space causing mediastinal shift. Requires emergent decompression.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J93.11 - Primary Spontaneous Pneumothorax
entries.content: Primary spontaneous pneumothorax. Pneumothorax occurring without apparent underlying lung disease, typically in young, tall, thin males. Often associated with apical blebs.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J93.12 - Secondary Spontaneous Pneumothorax
entries.content: Secondary spontaneous pneumothorax. Pneumothorax occurring as complication of underlying lung disease such as COPD, cystic fibrosis, or interstitial lung disease.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J98.4 - Other Disorders of Lung
entries.content: Other disorders of lung. Includes pulmonary calcification, cystic lung disease, and other specified lung disorders not classified elsewhere.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J98.2 - Interstitial Emphysema
entries.content: Interstitial emphysema (pneumomediastinum). Air in the mediastinal tissues, often from alveolar rupture. May track along bronchovascular bundles. Usually benign and self-limiting.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J98.11 - Atelectasis
entries.content: Atelectasis. Collapse or incomplete expansion of lung tissue. May be obstructive, compressive, or passive. CT shows volume loss with displacement of fissures and crowding of vessels.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J47.0 - Bronchiectasis with Acute Lower Respiratory Infection
entries.content: Bronchiectasis with acute lower respiratory infection. Chronic irreversible dilation of bronchi with superimposed acute infection. CT shows dilated, thick-walled airways with acute inflammatory changes.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J47.1 - Bronchiectasis with (Acute) Exacerbation
entries.content: Bronchiectasis with acute exacerbation. Chronic bronchiectasis with worsening symptoms but without documented infection. May show increased secretions or wall thickening on CT.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: J47.9 - Bronchiectasis, Uncomplicated
entries.content: Bronchiectasis, uncomplicated. Chronic irreversible dilation of bronchi without acute exacerbation. CT shows signet ring sign (dilated bronchus larger than adjacent vessel), tram track sign, or cluster of grapes appearance.

metadata.chapter: J - Diseases of the respiratory system

entries.title: Z87.09 - Personal History of Other Diseases of the Respiratory System
entries.content: Personal history of other diseases of the respiratory system. History of previous respiratory conditions that may be relevant to current care, such as prior tuberculosis, prior pneumonia, or resolved lung disease.

metadata.chapter: Z - Factors influencing health status

entries.title: Z85.118 - Personal History of Other Malignant Neoplasm of Bronchus and Lung
entries.content: Personal history of other malignant neoplasm of bronchus and lung. History of lung cancer that has been treated and is no longer present. Important for surveillance imaging interpretation.

metadata.chapter: Z - Factors influencing health status

entries.title: Z87.01 - Personal History of Pneumonia (Recurrent)
entries.content: Personal history of pneumonia (recurrent). History of recurrent pneumonia episodes. May indicate underlying structural abnormality, immunodeficiency, or aspiration risk.

metadata.chapter: Z - Factors influencing health status

entries.title: Z12.2 - Encounter for Screening for Malignant Neoplasm of Respiratory Organs
entries.content: Encounter for screening for malignant neoplasm of respiratory organs. Use for lung cancer screening CT in eligible patients. Per USPSTF: annual LDCT for adults 50-80 years with >=20 pack-year smoking history.

metadata.chapter: Z - Factors influencing health status

entries.title: Z77.22 - Contact with and (Suspected) Exposure to Environmental Tobacco Smoke
entries.content: Contact with and suspected exposure to environmental tobacco smoke (secondhand smoke). Relevant risk factor for lung disease and lung cancer screening considerations.

metadata.chapter: Z - Factors influencing health status

entries.title: F17.210 - Nicotine Dependence, Cigarettes, Uncomplicated
entries.content: Nicotine dependence, cigarettes, uncomplicated. Active cigarette smoking without documented complications. Important risk factor to document for lung imaging studies.

metadata.chapter: F - Mental and behavioral disorders
metadata.clinical_relevance: Major risk factor for lung cancer

entries.title: Z72.0 - Tobacco Use
entries.content: Tobacco use. Current tobacco use when dependence is not documented. Use when patient uses tobacco but does not meet criteria for dependence diagnosis.

metadata.chapter: Z - Factors influencing health status

entries.title: Z87.891 - Personal History of Nicotine Dependence
entries.content: Personal history of nicotine dependence. Former smoker. Important for lung cancer screening eligibility (quit within 15 years) and interpreting lung findings.

metadata.chapter: Z - Factors influencing health status
metadata.note: Still eligible for screening if quit <15 years ago

entries.title: R05.9 - Cough, Unspecified
entries.content: Cough, unspecified. Symptom that may prompt chest imaging. Chronic cough (>8 weeks) warrants evaluation for underlying pulmonary pathology.

metadata.chapter: R - Symptoms, signs and abnormal clinical and laboratory findings

entries.title: R06.02 - Shortness of Breath
entries.content: Shortness of breath (dyspnea). Common symptom prompting chest imaging. May indicate pulmonary, cardiac, or other systemic disease.

metadata.chapter: R - Symptoms, signs and abnormal clinical and laboratory findings

entries.title: R04.2 - Hemoptysis
entries.content: Hemoptysis. Coughing up blood or blood-stained sputum. Requires investigation to rule out malignancy, infection, or vascular abnormality.

metadata.chapter: R - Symptoms, signs and abnormal clinical and laboratory findings
metadata.workup: CT chest to evaluate for source

entries.title: R09.89 - Other Specified Symptoms and Signs Involving the Circulatory and Respiratory Systems
entries.content: Other specified symptoms and signs involving the circulatory and respiratory systems. Includes chest wall tenderness, abnormal sputum, and other respiratory symptoms not classified elsewhere.

metadata.chapter: R - Symptoms, signs and abnormal clinical and laboratory findings

entries.title: R22.2 - Localized Swelling, Mass and Lump, Trunk
entries.content: Localized swelling, mass and lump, trunk. May be used for palpable chest wall mass prompting imaging evaluation.

metadata.chapter: R - Symptoms, signs and abnormal clinical and laboratory findings
